radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver displays diffusely increased echogenicity consistent with fatty infiltration. No focal hepatic mass lesions are identified. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation with the common duct measuring 4 mm. The main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. The pancreas is not well visualized given overlying bowel gas and cannot be properly evaluated. The gallbladder is normal in appearance without wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid to suggest acute cholecystitis. There is no intraluminal gallstone or positive sonographic Murphy's sign demonstrated. No right upper quadrant abdominal ascites. The right kidney is normal in appearance without hydronephrosis. The spleen is mildly enlarged measuring 13.5 cm in greatest dimension.
Pancreatic uncinate process appears enlarged with peripancreatic fluid tracks inferiorly. Appendix could not be visualized.
